thread.title: Husband inspired me, says Great British Bake Off champ Nadiya Jamir Hussain
thread.title_full: Husband inspired me, says Great British Bake Off champ Nadiya Jamir Hussain

title: Husband inspired me, says Great British Bake Off champ Nadiya Jamir Hussain
text:
Husband inspired me, says Great British Bake Off champ Nadiya Jamir Hussain Husband inspired me, says Great British Bake Off champ Nadiya Jamir Hussain 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Great British Bake Off champion Nadiya Jamir Hussain has her husband to thank for pushing her to apply for the show, when she believed she had no chance of making it on to television. 
The stay-at-home mother walked out of the Bake Off tent “a much stronger, confident person” after being crowned winner of series six, beating Ian Cumming and Tamal Ray in an emotional final which had judge Mary Berry in tears. 
The 30-year-old, who became loved for her expressive face, said it was “surreal” to finally be able to talk about her achievement after keeping her win on the BBC show a secret. (Love Productions/BBC/PA) 
She told BBC Breakfast: “It feels like I’m relieving that moment again. It was one of the best moments of my life. 
“My husband (Abdul) tried to get me to apply two years ago and I said, ‘look, I don’t have the confidence to do something like this’, and this year he pretty much forced me and said, ‘you’re really good, you’re really clever, you should just do it, what’s the worst that will happen?’. 
“Those were famous last words. And I did it, and I went in and I applied and every stage of the process felt unlikely and like it wasn’t meant to happen. Promoted stories
